original_title: Sri Lanka cabinet approves proposed electricity sector reforms bill
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers has approved the proposed electricity sector reforms bill, cabinet spokesman minister Bandula Gunawardena said at a press briefing today.
The new bill will be gazetted and presented in parliament for approval.

“Once approved by the parliament, the new Electricity Act will enable the unbundling of CEB services, restructure CEB, improve efficiency, transparency and accountability and will allow private sector participation across generation, transmission and distribution,” power minister Kanchana Wijesekera said.
A condition of the IMF program is reform of state-owned enterprises, including the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB).
